intro: Gomphrena mariae, commonly known as the pink gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spiky inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, depending on the climate. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branched. Gomphrena mariae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
